titlestmt.titleproper: Indiana University Axolotl Colony newsletters, 1976-1998 C462
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to the Records at the Indiana University Archives
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Whitney S. Olthoff

change.item: Batch update to change repository name, subject links, preferred citation, and user restrictions.

did.abstract: The IU Axolotl Colony, started in 1957, was a National Science Foundation -funded breeding colony of Mexican axolotl located in the Department of Biology at Indiana University in Bloomington. The colony supplied axolotl embryos, larvae and adults to laboratories for use in genetic research and to classrooms until the colony was moved to the University of Kentucky in 2005. Collection consists of newsletters.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Indiana University Axolotl Colony was derived from the colony at the University of Buffalo, from which the axolotls were transferred to Bloomington in August 1957. The colony, located in the Department of Biology, was funded by the National Science Foundation as a Living Stock Collection under the Division of Biological Infrastructure. From the colony, axolotl embryos, larvae and adults were shipped to laboratories and classrooms around the world, primarily for genetic research. Axolotls have regenerative abilities and can regrow nerve cells, limbs, and possibly internal organs, which makes them useful in genetic research. In June 2005, the colony at Indiana University was transferred to the University of Kentucky.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into one series of Newsletters arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of one series, Newsletters, arranged in chronological order dating from Fall 1976 to Fall 1998 in a full run.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory.
Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Axolotl Colony newsletters, Collection C462, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Newsletters were pulled from the Henry H. H. Remak papers, Collection C442.
